abstract.value: Robert Bender was a member of Students for a Democratic Society. He was a political activist in Newark, NJ, in his early years, and served for two years (1962-1964) as Executive Director of New Jersey Americans for Democratic Action. During his tenure at ADA he guided the organization toward ever-deeper involvement in the civil rights movement. This collection of papers pertains mainly to the Students for a Democratic Society, nationally and in Newark, NJ. Included are reports, publications, publicity flyers, correspondence from the 1960s, and a small amount of material dealing with political action in New Jersey in general.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Robert Bender Collection on Students for a Democratic Society; TAM 409; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Robert Bender in 2007. The accession number associated with this gift is 2007.024.

Robert Bender was a member of Students for a Democratic Society. He was a political activist in Newark, NJ, in his early years, and served for two years (1962-1964) as Executive Director of New Jersey Americans for Democratic Action.  During his tenure at ADA he guided the organization toward ever-deeper involvement in the civil rights movement.  He stepped down in 1964 to pursue a Masters degree at Rutgers University's Labor-Management Institute.  He went on to be associated professionally with a number of labor and political organizations in New Jersey, and was a member of the Solidarity Singers and New Jersey Peace Action, among other groups.

This collection of papers pertains mainly to the Students for a Democratic Society, nationally and in Newark, NJ. Included are reports, publications, publicity flyers, correspondence from the 1960s, and a small amount of material dealing with political action in New Jersey in general.
